item.title: What is TOCTOU
item.description: TOCTOU mean Time-of-Check to Time-of-Use. It’s a bug where it involves checking the state of the system and using the result. Example if (access("file", W_OK) != 0) { exit(1); } fd = open("file", O_WRONLY); write(fd, buffer, sizeof(buffer)); Here an attacker can create a symlink after the access but before the open call, resulting in a malicious file to be open. Synonyms TOCTTOU TOC/TOU Source Wikipedia

item.title: What is Symlink
item.description: A symbolic link is a file that contains a reference to another file. That reference take form as a path in its absolute or relative form. A symlink may contains a path that point to nothing Synonym symlink soft link

item.title: What is Environment Table
item.description: An Environment Table is a table that is accessible by each process Some Environment variable to know about name description PATH used to list each directory to search for binary HOME a directory to be considered as the home directory of the current user PWD the current working directory Source Wikipedia

item.title: What is File Permission
item.description: Each file as his own permission set. It allows to control the ability of the users to view, change, navigate, and execute the contents of the file system Notation for Unix system Permission can be seen in its symbolic notation using ls -l $ ls -l total 16 -rw-rw-r-- 1 level03 level03 0 Aug 2 17:22 foo with ls -l the 1st column is used to represent the file type and his permission.

item.title: What is Rainbow table
item.description: A Rainbow table is a table of precomputed-hash values generated from hash function. It is generally used to crack password. Source Wikipedia

item.title: What is Brute Force Attack
item.description: In cryptography, a brute force attack is when an attacker submit as many as possible passwords with the hope to guess the right password Source Wikipedia

item.title: What is Hash Function
item.description: A hash function is a function that can take data of arbitrary size and output data to fixed size. The output of a hash function is called: hash value hashes digest For example a hash function can be used to map name to index in a fixed-size table (hash table) we call this process hashing Source Wikipedia

item.title: What is Rot Permutation
item.description: A Rot Permutation or Cesar Permutation is a method to transform a phrase into another by permuting char with another nth letter generally we add the amount of rotation to the function name: rotXX | rot-XX where XX is the rotation count Example 1 5 10 13 26 … a b f k n a … b c g l o b … c d h m p c … … … … … … … … With rot13 hello world become uryyb jbeyq

item.title: What is Ctf
item.description: CTF stand for Capture The Flag(s). It’s a type of game/exercise were you, the player need to find the flag. The flag is generally a string, but it can be represented in other way.

item.title: What is Vm
item.description: VM stand for Virtual Machine, it’s a “machine” that will be run inside another machine. Crazy right ? To use a virtual Machine we some software like VirtualBox or VMWare
